rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Professor Wu is a very nice man, and wants the class to do well. The only problem is that he's not good at helping the class do well. One lecture might cover a whole chapter, another might cover one or two sections of a chapter. He spends too long on derivations, and not enough time ensuring class understanding. Prepare to teach yourself

Considering the overall quality of teachers in this department, he's not bad.  He knows his stuff, but is not very clear so you don't loose much by not coming.  Schroeder's book was very helpful...usually much clearer than Wu.  Tests are not very difficult.  Fair in partial credit, so at least put down the correct formula if you are out of time.
Great professor and great person. Once you get over accent, very very helpful. Let class go because only few people showed up after a 21st b-day celebration :) .
Hard, but not difficult to understand. His tests are not impossible if you study well. Also, be sure to do the homework, since it is a large part of your grade.
I have not heard one student say they liked his class (out of dozens).
